briefTitle: Topical Ibuprofen for Delayed Onset Mulscle Soreness
officialTitle: PLACEBO-CONTROLLED, DOUBLE-BLIND EVALUATION OF THE EFFICACY AND SAFETY OF IBUPROFEN 5% TOPICAL GEL FOR THE TREATMENT OF DELAYED-ONSET MUSCLE SORENESS OF THE ELBOW FLEXOR MUSCLES
summary: The objective of this study is to compare the efficacy and safety of Ibuprofen 5% Topical Gel versus placebo administered two or three times daily for the treatment of pain associated with delayed onset muscle soreness following intense eccentric exercise of the elbow flexor muscles.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Time-Weighted Sum of Muscle Soreness With Movement Over 0-24 Hours Post-Dose 1 (MSM 0-24 )
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline, 0 to 24 hours post-Dose 1 on Day 1
